messageBody:
Hi Vince,

On 10/22/07, ovisual12 <ovisual12@...> wrote:
> My name is Vince and I am looking for a reliable solution to testing EJB's. I have came
> across various tools including XJB, EJBUnit, Embedded Jboss, Cactus, etc.. I am just
> wondering which solution is the most mature and most supported by the community. I need
> to be able to mock up JNDI so that I can test the persistance in my EJB's. I would like to test
> outside the container as I hear this is the best method for testing EJBs. Can anyone give me
> some suggestions and point me in the right direction. Any help would be greatly appreciate,
> a tutorial anything that will help get me started. I would preferable like a solution that can fit
> into a night build and test enviornment. We use Continuum to build and test our companies
> code everynight. If I could drive the EJB test cases from a Maven pom that would be a bonus.

When I need to work with EJBs, I tend to do three things:
1) Minimize the amount of code in EJB classes.
2) Isolate dependencies to improve testability of the EJB classes.
3) Test the EJB code with the help of MockContextFactory from the
MockEJB project.

(Well, this is for the old 2.x-style EJBs. The new EJB 3.0
specification makes things easier.)

Also, the chapter of my book that talks about test-driving EJB
components is freely available from the publisher's website so you
might want to grab that one, too:

http://www.manning.com/koskela

Lasse
